intro: Tetragonanthus heterantha, commonly known as the four-angle sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent, four-angled stems. The leaves are typically fleshy and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This species is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils.
